answers.answer: There can be several reasons of your right sided body numbness although without being able to examine you I can not offer you the specific advice on diagnosis and treatment that you need, but I would try to provide you some relevant information about your health concern.Most likely your symptoms could be due to injury to a nerve, pressure on spinal/peripheral nerves (neuropathy), vitamin deficiency, lack of blood supply due to cholesterol plaque from atherosclerosis in the extremities, viral infection and use of certain medications.  In addition, atherosclerosis can also cause pain, numbness, and tingling while walking and they can also reduce blood supply and lead to numbness. Please consult your doctor to get all these possibilities evaluation in your case for further assessment. Hope this helps.

question: hello im a 32 year old male with right sided numbness. at first it only happend when i sat or was active alot but now it is constant. i have numbness on my right side in my hand foot part of my arm on the outside and my right vision has changed.i was in the emergency room where they did a ct scan and said that it didnt seem to be stroke related. i have diabetes and was thikning it might be that but i dont think that can cause numbness in my face also on the right side. some days the symptoms are better then others and are much easier to deal with. other days there horrible and bother me to the point that i cant get anything done. im disabled from my weight so its hard for me to get out to doctors beciuase i have no vehicle. what im wondering tho could this be the onset of ms ?  i forgot to mention i have hemachromatosis but i dont believe that can cause these types of symptoms please any advice would be great thanks
title: right sided symptoms no diagnoses
